intro: Eriocaulon longipedunculatum, commonly known as the long-pedunculate flat sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments. Its inflorescence consists of a long, slender peduncle bearing numerous tiny spikelets. Eriocaulon longipedunculatum plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetlands and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
